name: Surya's Command
effect: Clears 1 house of Tamasic fog. Grants +2 Strength to Lagna Lord.
description: The absolute authority of the Sun. Highly effective against Saturnian debuffs, but burns Venus if placed in the same house.

name: Chandra's Shield
effect: Restores +5 Prana (Health) and neutralizes one Ashtamastha (8th house) curse.
description: Cooling and restorative. Essential for surviving the Sade Sati levels or heavy Maraka transits.

name: Mangal's Strike
effect: Deals 6 damage to an enemy Graha. If played in the 3rd or 6th house, deals double damage.
description: The fiery spear of the commander. Powerful, but playing it in the 4th or 7th house triggers a Mangal Dosha penalty to your own defenses.

name: Budha's Calculation
effect: Draw 2 additional cards. If the Prashna Lagna is Gemini or Virgo, draw 3.
description: The rapid intellect of the prince. Excellent for cycling through your deck, but easily influenced by malefic cards in your hand.

name: Guru's Blessing
effect: Grants complete immunity to all debuffs for 2 turns. Expands max Prana by +10.
description: The ultimate Bhavottama protection. A heavy cost, but provides massive, expansive shielding against Saturn and Rahu strikes.

name: Shukra's Sanjivani
effect: Resurrects one defeated Graha or restores Lagna health to 100%.
description: The secret knowledge of the Asura Guru. Beautiful and restorative, but blinds the player to illusions (Rahu) for 1 turn.

name: Shani's Delay
effect: Locks the enemy's highest-cost card for 3 turns. Deals 2 damage per turn.
description: The slow, crushing weight of karma. Incredibly heavy to cast, but permanently alters the structure of the battlefield.

name: Rahu's Eclipse
effect: Steals 1 random card from the enemy's hand and changes its ruling planet to Rahu.
description: Sudden, explosive, and deceptive. Breaks the standard rules of the game but generates massive karmic debt.

name: Ketu's Severance
effect: Destroys all cards (both yours and the enemy's) currently on the board.
description: The headless monk. Absolute detachment. Use only when the board is overwhelmed and you must wipe the slate clean.
